summaryText: Wow, what an incredible message from Pastor Darrison Tellez about waiting and perseverance! The sermon on Hannah's story in 1 Samuel was a powerful reminder that just because something is 'closed' doesn't mean it's 'cancelled'. Pastor Darrison beautifully unpacked how our seasons of waiting aren't punishment, but preparation. Can you imagine being so desperate for God's promise that you'd keep praying even when everyone thinks you look crazy? Hannah's story reminds us that faithfulness often looks like foolishness to the world! Pastor shared a personal story about his daughter's desperate pursuit of her 'boyfriend' to illustrate how true desperation can keep us focused. The key takeaway? God might close doors temporarily, but He never cancels His plans for you. When you're at your breaking point, you're closest to your breakthrough! Sometimes God has to press you to reveal the most authentic version of yourself. Just like Hannah, who kept pushing in prayer until God not only gave her Samuel but used him to select King David - which ultimately led to Jesus' lineage. Isn't it amazing how God can use our seemingly impossible situations to create generational impact?
mainPoints: What is closed is not cancelled
Faithfulness looks like foolishness to the world

versesMentioned.text: Hope deferred makes the heart sick, but a longing fulfilled is a tree of life.
What, then, shall we say in response to these things? If God is for us, who can be against us?
But seek first his kingdom and his righteousness, and all these things will be given to you as well.
The words 'once more' indicate the removing of what can be shaken—that is, created things—so that what cannot be shaken may remain.

But God chose the foolish things of the world to shame the wise; God chose the weak things of the world to shame the strong. God chose the lowly things of this world and the despised things—and the things that are not—to nullify the things that are, so that no one may boast before him.

Monday.scripture: Jeremiah 29:11: 'For I know the plans I have for you,' declares the Lord, 'plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future.'
Monday.focus: Understanding God's plan during waiting seasons
Monday.action: Write down an area of your life where you feel 'stuck' or waiting. Reflect on how this might actually be a season of preparation, not punishment.
Monday.prayer: Lord, help me trust Your timing. Give me patience and perspective to see this waiting season as an opportunity for growth and preparation. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Isaiah 40:31: 'But those who hope in the Lord will renew their strength. They will soar on wings like eagles; they will run and not grow weary, they will walk and not be faint.'
Tuesday.action: List three specific ways you can actively hope and trust God today, even in uncertainty. Practice speaking positive declarations over your situation.
Tuesday.prayer: God, renew my strength today. Help me to hope in You and not my circumstances. Give me faith to see beyond what is visible. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Psalm 27:14: 'Wait for the Lord; be strong and take heart and wait for the Lord.'
Wednesday.action: Identify one area where you've been tempted to give up. Commit to praying specifically for breakthrough in that area for the next 30 days.
Wednesday.prayer: Father, strengthen my resolve. Help me to wait patiently and expectantly, knowing that You are always working, even when I cannot see. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: James 1:4: 'Let perseverance finish its work so that you may be mature and complete, not lacking anything.'
Thursday.action: Journal about a past challenge where perseverance led to growth. Reflect on how that experience prepared you for future opportunities.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, teach me to see challenges as opportunities for spiritual growth. Help me embrace the process of becoming more like You. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Galatians 6:9: 'Let us not become weary in doing good, for at the proper time we will reap a harvest if we do not give up.'
Friday.action: Make a list of promises or dreams you're believing God for. Pray over each one, recommitting your trust to God's perfect timing.
Friday.prayer: God, renew my hope today. Help me to stay faithful and not grow weary. I trust Your timing and Your plan. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Habakkuk 2:3: 'For the revelation awaits an appointed time; it speaks of the end and will not prove false. Though it linger, wait for it; it will certainly come and will not delay.'
Saturday.action: Spend time in quiet reflection. Ask God to reveal any areas where you need to trust His timing more fully. Be open to His guidance.
Saturday.prayer: Lord, give me patience and peace. Help me trust that You are working, even when I cannot see. Align my heart with Your perfect plan. Amen.
